marking functionalities, and displays points of interest and NPCs. The
Overlay Map displays an extended format of the Minimap displaying the
entire Zone the player is in. This overlay is slightly transparent and is
placed on the central part

of the screen. The game world cycles between
day and night every 15 minutes, altering lighting of outdoor areas. This
cycle is synchronised server wide. Days begin at 6:00 AM Game Time, and
end at 6:00 PM Game Time. Nights begin at 6:00 PM Game Time and end at
6:00 AM Game Time. Certain NPCs, creatures, events, or resources may spawn
only during either day or night. Overworld Street Signs, interactable

between them, naming is just for navigation purposes.. Each Continent has
its Area BossZones may be instanced for a single player, for a group of
players in case of activities, or not instanced.arena type dimension for
testing equipment, Abilities, creatures, everything, dps dummies etc The
server counts days, weeks and month

for timing or gating specific
contents. Daily Resets occur at 0:00 AM every day. Weekly Resets occur at
0:00 AM on every Monday. Monthly Resets occur at 0:00 AM on the 1st of
every month.Game updates are made on Mondays at 6:00 AM Server Time. The
game chat follows the same system across all games. It is divided into
tabs which display specific types of chat, from friends, communities,
clans, and the game itself. Players may toggle on or off tabs, or view
exclusively the dialogue in a specific tab.Players can tag items into chat
by holding Shift and clicking it while having the chat on. This allows
other players to view the item by clicking its tagged name in the chat
box.Player and NPC dialogue is shown in chat bubbles above their model,
alongside the chat box.Players can type emoticons by opening the Emoticon
interface or by typing the emoticon’s name between colons
(:emoticon:).Players may say Statements through the Statements interface,
which contains general premade phrases. These phrases may also contai

account related variables which allows players to state their
accomplishments to other, i.e.: “I have killed X goblins.” Parties can be
formed by sending an invitation to another player, with the player who
first sent the invitation being deemed Party Leader. The Party Leader can
promote another player to Leader, kick party members, and invite other
players. The other members in a party can appoint invites to the Leader
and request kicks. Players outside of the party can request to be invited
by the Leader. All these requests last for 15 seconds on a player’s screen
if not dismissed or accepted.Parties can have a maximum of 4 players.
Parties can only be formed by players within 15 levels of each
other.Instead of directly granted to the player credited with the kill,
experience from killing creatures is instead equally split amongst the
Party members.Parties are used for a variety of content matchmaking,
letting players experience the content in a premade group or having one
arranged or filled up by the match

making system. Inspect option on players
can open profilePlayers can set their own Flavour Text, which will be
shown to other players when their profile is inspected. Other player’s
summons and ability effects are highly transparent. They may be disabled
entirely, or have the transparency removed through the game settings.
Enemies in PVP situations will not have transparent abilities for
clarity.Every game location has its specific weather and skybox, with no
gameplay effects. This is not dynamic or customizable by the player. There
are two types, Cutscenes, which are rendered in game and Cinematics, which
are pre-rendered videos. Both can be skipped by pressing the ESC key. Both
types of cutscenes have subtitles on by default, which can be turned off
through the game settings. The game has an opening cinematic, which plays
upon creating a character and displays that character’s backstory? The
camera is by default locked to a fixed isometric angle view. Scrolling the
mouse wheel can zoom the camera in or out,

up to a minimum and maximum
distance. The Page Up and Page Down keys automatically set the camera zoom
to its maximum or default values. It is possible to disable zooming in the
game’s settings.Camera grip with the mouse wheel allows dragging the
camera view up to a fixed distance away, making it possible to view an
area ahead of you. Releasing the grip automatically snaps the camera back
